Water was offered a couple of times through the night or you could press the overhead call button and someone appeared almost instantly.Breakfast was served in the morning which was also enjoyable. Title:
I have not experienced such poor service or uninterested staff on any other flight.
Ignoring the fact that our return flight was cancelled by Air Mauritius without any email communication or any alternative being offered.
We took the 16.20 flight on 14 August from CDG direct to Mauritius. As a family we had a row of 3 seat in row 33 with my mum being in row 31 with extra leg room. First the flight attendant told her that she couldn’t store her water to the side of the seat, no problem, but didn’t tell her where she could then came back and said I have told you before you can’t leave that there in a rather loud and condescending voice, snatched the bottle from her and placed it out of reach (we had no idea how happy we would be to have that bottle later)
There was no drinks service on board and in fact the meal was served within 2hrs of take off, with no drinks offered before or after so that was the one chance for a beverage. During the flight you had to go to the galley and ask for water, which was provided in a cup that was only half full, as if it was being rationed and it was clear that the staff resented the interruption. There were no other soft drinks available. As the staff were not forthcoming with drinks this made the aisle very busy as everyone was up and down to the galley.
Breakfast was served about 90 minutes before landing and all the baked goods were either stale or still cold/partly frozen.
The young girl in the seat next to my mum started to vomit, and the staff did not offer any assistance or sick bags, until they were called.
It appeared as if anything asked of the cabin crew was an inconvenience.
We had booked with Air France but the flight was operated by Air Mauritius, but the price was higher booking with them direct that through AF.
Since the cancellation of our return flight we are now travelling with Air France, so hope for a better journey.

Title: We are frequent travellers and used many airlines for both short and long-haul flights.   On this occassion we feel it necessary to make other potential passengers aware of what to expect with Air Mauritius travelling Economy.    I only booked with them as they currently offer a direct flight from Heathrow, and I opted to travel from Shropshire (circa 3 hours) for the convenience.   However, the level of comfort is poor at the very best.   It was impossible to move and use the tray in front when seats are reclined.   Subsequently, if you have a passenger in-front who wishes to fully recline their seat, you're trapped!   The tray is rendered useless and it is impossible to use to eat or (in my case) to use a small laptop.   We were offered two choices of food, one 1/2 hour in the flight, the other, circa 45 mins before landing.   No refreshments were offered for cica 8 hours and no facility to self-serve.  Refreshments were offered (one) at meal times.   I opted for a cup of tea - it was basically hot water and I had to ask the cabin crew for a replacement. However, it seemed perfectly acceptable to them to serve what they had without a care that it contained.    Don't buy the in-flight wifi!!   Mine lasted 30 minutes into the flight to simply check emails and then was prompted to pay a further £20 (approx.) as I had supposedly ran out of data, despite not downloading or streaming anything.  The wifi speed was terrible.   It was truly a disastrous 13 hour experience from take-off to landing, one I have never experienced before in around 30 years of flying.    Even more annoying was when I relayed my concerns to their "Customer Service" Team in Mauritius by email.   In fairness, they acknowledged receipt, asked for information they could have easily obtained from the information provided in my initial email, and then didn't bother to respond back despite sending two further emails.   I am not one of those people who complain for the sake of, and this is the first time I have ever left a negative review for an Airline.   My advice to any UK traveller is to avoid this airline as they clearly have no interest in the customers' experience.  They had an opportunity to at least acknowledge and investigate my complaint, but clearly are not bothered.    A disgrace to the name "Mauritius" as it's a beautiful country and great people.

qwuub: Customer Services Ignore You & In-Flight Food/Seat Pitch & Wifi TERRIBLE

Title:
My issue with airlines currently isn't aimed specifically at air mauritius but at the industry as a whole. Air Mauritius were fine but nothing special. They were certainly better than some other national airlines I have flown but they in no way excelled.

The positives were in the service and the crew, they were prompt, attentive, polite and pleasant.

The negatives lay in the food and in flight entertainment. In economy you expect a certain level of food which is not very high, in this case even those expectations were not met. It takes a lot for me to not finish a meal, especially when I was as hungry as I was but I just couldn't stomach it.

Most of the inflight options weren't available from the entertainment station which wouldn't be a problem during an overnight flight, had sleeping been at all possible. I gave up and started watching a film but for me, there really wasn't that much choice.

Pre and early flight it was frustrating that every few minutes announcements were being made. I fully understand why these have to be done but it was very frustrating to have one announcement finish, and then 30 seconds later another would start, or it would be repeated in another language. This meant constantly removing and replacing headphones or having to pause conversations having only just restarted them.

My advice would be to either space them out more or do them seamlessly so as not to constantly Interupt people.

There was also a pre flight delay that was never communicated in any way until after everyone had boarded which was slightly annoying

Over all though given all thenissues around flying right now this experience could have been a lot worse.
qwuub: Above average during a difficult time

Title:
We were nearly landing in Mauritius when the plane diverted to Madagascar due to a cyclone. Air Mauritius provided shuttles to an Ibis hotel, covered all the buffet meals while we were there (and accommodation). There was a lack of shuttle buses so many people had to wait long periods to reach the hotel. We took a taxi and paid ourselves, which was a great idea. The room and food was arranged without us requesting it, so we're grateful for that.

Communication was good in terms of catching a flight the next day to Mauritius. Legroom was good on the flight. The food was inedible, which is my only complaint. Airline staff was lovely, friendly and accommodating.

All in all a great trip, they handled the delay well and will definitely consider flying with them again.

Title:
I normally use Cathay Pacific or Singapore Airlines. Since we are visiting a friend in Kenya, a friend recommended Air Mauritius. I never had problems with luggage and hand carry etc. I bought a walking stick/cane made of ebony for my father in law and this was packaged well. We have limit of 30 kilos and mine just 16 kilos, the cane was under a kilo or so. We got to the counter to check in. I was told that I will need to pay extra for it unless we attach the cane to the luggage (as I am apparently only alowed 1 check in bag) and this cost 3000 KES to attach it to the luggage. I asked if I can take it as hand carry and was told no, for security reasons.
We had to make a decision to leave the cane with the security. The security was surprised as the item had no issue with the security and the cane went through the x-ray machine.
I have asked passengers with multiple bags and was told they didn't have to pay extra for theirs. I am just heart broken.
I have travelled with other airlines and never had this problem. I will never fly with these guys again.

Title:
I was pleased to see they have finally updated their planes but I found the overall service quite lacking.
First of all, some of the staff in the outbound flight were quite rude. I called an assistant to ask for water but due to the engine noise it's quite difficult to hear. I tried to repeat but he just walked away while I was still talking.
The return flight seemed like an horror movie: 1 hour from departure they started serving food; after a few minutes a woman starts shouting for help. The husband's face was a contorted grimace. Luckily there was a doctor onboard to treat him, but Air Mauritius staff were helpless. The doctor told them off a few times.
Didn't help that after a few minutes another passenger felt unwell. People started to worry there was something wrong. The staff made no effort whatsoever to reassure the other passengers.

Fortunately we made it all the way home albeit almost 1 hour late. When the plane stopped and the seat belt sign went off people started to get their stuff to get out.
After 10 minutes an irate stewardess told us to seat down. Apparently the NHS had to get onboard before we could get out. If they had told us before we would have waited.

Cherry on top of the cake, we found ALL OUR FOUR luggage had been left back in Mauritius, despite having checked-in more than 2 hours before the flight.
We got our luggage back after 3 day, all battered and with the content wet.

Needless to say I'll avoid Air Mauritius in future.

Title:
First time taking Air Mauritius and I must say I am really pleasantly surprised by the level and quality of service rendered. The planes are of newer models so the inflight entertainment touchscreen works really well and fast, though the range of latest releases are quite limited. The seats and tables are quite clean and prior to taking off they use a disinfectant spray to disinfect the plane’s aisle. They also provided a blue air Mauritius sling pouch bag with toiletries and a pair of socks and eye mask in it, which was super useful and I ended up using the pouch throughout my trip.

However, the food selections and quality weren’t great (chicken or fish). For our onward journey we had curry chicken rice (which was the nicest option), but the fish was a tad dry and tasteless. On the return flight, also only fish and chicken option but this time it was chicken noodles, the fish was the same though! The good thing was that the bread buns are individually pouched, which meant we could take it out if we can’t finish it on the flight.

Service was ok, with a couple of drinks served and also a snack (pretzel) served for the morning.

Interesting tip: each of their airlines have a unique name to it and the pilot would share that on the flight or you can spot it before boarding. Mine was aapravasi ghat, which is a UNESCO heritage site for indentured labourers (interesting place that I would recommend you to visit).

Overall the experience was great and I would take this airline again!

Title: Cape Town residents are offered only two flights a week on the direct Air Mauritius service but can also choose to go via ORT where the schedule is more regular, but which still involves a 06.00 connector to ORT to catch the most convenient SAA190 service to the island. Having done this earlier in the year, I decided to brave the direct flight very recently. I use the description "brave" with intent as the flight leaves shortly after 22.00 and arrives in Plaisance around 05.00. That means sleeping rythms are shattered, especially given the two hour time diff on arrival. With dinner only being wrapped up at around 01.30 Mauritian time, the chances of any shut-eye are slim. Worse still, the arrival time on the island means that hotel check-in is likely to be a delayed affair but it does also mean that queues at immigration are more likley to be non-existent as was the case. So, for CPT residents, the convenience of avoiding ORT is off-set to a degree and I suspect this direct route is marginally more expensive too. On balance, I'd stick with direct more particularly because the return MK844 flight offers more amenable hours and a considerable time saving on the ORT diversion.As for the speciifics of the flight, the aircraft was a very new Airbus A330-900neo which flies beautifully and is remarkably quiet, even when seated behind the wing. Overhead bin space is especially good but Air Mauritius rather spoils everything by cramming in too many seats. Pitch is mean - I'm guessing at 31 - and the seats themselves, although swathed in attractive pale blue and grey fabric, are the new "thin shell" type and are a bit shapeless as a result. If the passenger in front uses full recline, you need to resemble a circus trapeze artist to get out! The infotainment system is very good, supplemented by a choice of external cameras and a full-house package of info on the progress of the flight.  Crew attitude was friendly and efficient and the dinner/beverages option was rather good by normal Y class standards. On descent, only water or fruit juice is offered so stock up while  you have the dinner option in front of you.  All arrival paperwork was handed out early in the flight which was appreciated. Altogether, a decent effort by Air Mauritius but that outbound schedule is a bit draining such that day one on the island was accompanied by lots of yawns.
qwuub: Direct in the dead of night!

Title: Flights to Rodrigues from Mauritius are only provided by Air Mauritius so this is Hobson’s Choice - there are no other options so no competition.For non-Mauritians it costs about £100 each way.  The flight distance is about 300km so this seems to me to be one of the most expensive economy flights in the world!The flights are on twin propellor planes that take about 60 passengers.  The seats are compact (being polite!) and space reduces as the fuselage tapers towards the rear.  Seats at the front are a bit of a nuisance as the overhead lockers are filled with equipment needed by the crew so bags have to be stowed a few rows behind you - if there is space.  Luggage allowance is a tiny 15kg unless you have a Kestrel Flyer reward, or being on an international transit entitled to the luggage allowance of the longer flight.  But, be warned, if there is no room then bags might be deferred to the next flight.  My relatives used the flight this weekend (16 November) - one had a suitcase delayed on the way out and the other has a lost suitcase on the way back (I’m sure It will turn up - after all nothing like a case full of dirty laundry to find it’s Way home!).Departure us from the domestic terminal at La Plaisance.  There is nothing to cause confusion as this is the ONLY domestic flight in Mauritius so you cannot get lost.Boarding and disboarding means catching a small overheated bus which has very few seats.  People with children or disabilities need to arrive early and nudge for seats, otherwise it is standing room only for the short journey.  Arriving at the plane is often chaotic as there seems to be no procedure.  Everyone just mills around the steps pushing forward for position.  But getting in the plane early has no advantage in this chaos as there is always someone blocking the aisle as they juggle some oversized luggage into the tiny lockers.  I often wonder why Air Mauritius staff could not be a little more organized - board elderly, disabled and children first, then all other passengers could board in sequence by row numbers.The flight is often away in time, for the 90 minutes in the air, the flight crew give basic departure, flight, and arrival information.  When airborne there is a hot coffee, fruit juice, and snack box, served at your seat.  Given most no-frills airlines have removed such refreshments to cut costs it is really good that AM continues with in-flight refreshments.  Menu options can be selected on the website, when working, and this is essential for dietary choices as no spares are carried on the flight.The excitement of arriving in Rodrigues, or Mauritius, in daylight and seeing the glorious Baie Topaze as the plane descends to the tiny airport is a joy.

Title:
Booked through an agent who reserved our seats 3E&F for trips both way. This review is about the outward journey 5pm flight on the 8th September our wedding anniversary. Check in was quick. Into the lounge within 25 minutes. However the priority security queue was slower than normal security. Once in the lounge the choice of foods was acceptable. Nothing exciting but more than adequate for a 11+ hour flight. We managed to get some friends into the lounge to celebrate with us. The champagne was not free flowing had to ask a couple of times for a new bottle. Heineken on tap though.... once called to board the process was a bit chaotic. Seemed that business class was not a benefit. Ho-hum we got on the plane a fairly new A330. However at 175cm and 88kg I have to say the seats were very small to sit in. They tapered in at the footwell. Staff were very helpful and the food offerings were excellent. Hot and delicious with more than enough choice. Drinks kept coming for the first 2 hours. Then they dried up. Had to ask for them. In flight entertainment not that up to date. Hardly any “new releases” mainly 6 months and older. The rest of the entertainment system not that great. Also plenty of dubbing for naughty words in the films. the screen sizes were incredible though. See pictures. Another issue is the noise from the engines. Considering your are 30 feet from the cockpit the engine noise is extremely loud. Earplugs were required to sleep. Now to the flat bed. Okay I’m no skinny athlete but I’m hardly obese either. I could not sleep on my back with my arms by my side. Had to hold them above my head. The beds were not that comfortable and the temperature in the plane fluctuated. I managed about 4 hours disturbed sleep in all. Flight was on time and arrived safely. Exiting the aircraft was a free for all. Then as “premium” customers we were asked to go through security in the privilege line. Well the normal lines were empty so that took forever. Our bags came out fairly quickly but some friends that were in economy took over 55 minutes to arrive. All in all an average experience.

More on the home leg later.
qwuub: Tried another carrier than the usual BA

Title:
We flew from Antananarivo (TNR) to Mauritius (MRU) on September 13 in Business Class. The ticket was purchased on the Air Mauritius website for around USD 460 per person for the 1 way trip. Even though the flight time was less than 2 hours, we wanted to try Business Class and the ticket was only about $100 more than flying Economy.

At TNR airport, Air Mauritius check in opens 3 hours before the flight. Since we were in Business Class, we were able to use the Air France Lounge which is next to Gate 1A. There were food and drinks.

The flight time was 4:50 pm and when we walked to the gate at 4 pm, every one was pretty much boarded. We walked on the tarmac onto the plane. No photos were allowed of the outside of the plane.

Juice and water is served pre flight. No alcoholic drinks were served.

We actually departed at 4:30 pm, 20 minutes before our scheduled departure time.

The food was OK. It was like a cold plate where the food still tasted very cold. Service was also just OK.

Our flight was only 1 hour and 20 minutes and we landed 25 minutes early.

The seats were very comfortable and Business Class was very empty. Even though it was a short flight, we thought the seats were very comfortable.
qwuub: Flew Business Class from TNR to MRU

Title:
The review of the airline includes the experience of the airline at OR International airport in Johannesburg, South Africa. The service at the airport was average; it was South African Airways (SAA) staff on duty. This could be because of a joint-venture / code-sharing agreement between the two airlines. There was a bit of delay in helping passengers in the queue. A lady staff in Business Class counter was not busy but did not assist even though there was no Business Class passengers to assist. SUGGESTION: Assist passengers and "get them away" as quickly as possible. Another lady staff that assisted us was not friendly in the beginning but eventually warmed up because of engagement with my kids. At the boarding gate, the service was poor. Business Class queue was not busy and a staff member was not pro-actively calling out families with children to be assisted. SUGGESTION: call out families with children into an empty counter to reduce length in queues and still give preference to Business Class passengers if they arrive after the families that are in the Business Class queue. Once in the aircraft, it was clear that it was an old aircraft. The quality in the cabin was evident - from seat design to infotainment to storage compartment, etc. When the flight took off, it took a while for the infotainment to be active and in operational mode; that was frustrating. The experience on the infotainment was not great and the flight information was showing a return trip, which was odd. The air-hostess would also provide headphones much later after take-off and collect it over 30min before landing; it was a short time to use the infotainment system. It took also quite a while for food to be served; this could be so that they do not have to serve something close to arrival time. There was no food menu print-out to read and as such had to decide on the spot when the air-hostess asked you. Leg room is limited for tall passengers with my knees touching the handle of the front seats. One good thing provided was a small bag of goodies for children in the flight; that is thoughtful of the airline.
The experience of the airline on our return flight was a better experience. However, with South Africans being frequent visitors to Mauritius, it is quite inconvenient to fly into and out of Mauritius in terms of timing. You arrive in Mauritius and exit the airport around 8:30pm and passengers have to be at the airport for return flights to South Africa around 6:30am. There is two days lost in the holiday travel for South African passengers.
The advantage of Air Mauritius is they offer good packages at differnet times of the year; e.g. flight costs can be free for children and only airport taxes have to paid for if a hotel package is bought as well. Please check airline website of consult travel agency for more details.
qwuub: Unexpected average service from a tourist destination airline

Title:
We decided on a non stop flight to begin with to get the journey over and done with which turned out to be the wrong decision. The only upgrade was Business Class which was the same cost again for each of us. You could offer a price for BC on their internet site but it was set at a high price. The seats going were row 14 and were very uncomfortable I am average size 74kg and 175cm tall, we changed the seats on the flight back to row 44 which were slightly better. Once you book your meal which was vegetarian going and very bland, only warm I decided to try and change this on our return flight but again their site would not allow this. The staff were very friendly but did not always remember your requests. The flight entertainment was very poor with films that were not new and out of date. So for paying premium prices £830 each we felt cheated compared to other airlines we have travelled with eg Emirates to India were more comfortable - easier to upgrade with fair prices - better entertainment - and more cost effective.
We discussed this with other travellers in Mauritius as well as locals who all said that its best to fly to Mauritius with a stop. They suggested Emirates, Turkish or Lufthansa which will be done if we return to Mauritius again.

Title:
When one boards a flight, one looks for convenience, entertainment, hospitality and proper service. Air mauritius' flight which i took from delhi to mauritius along with three others on 28 july, 2019 MK 745 with departure scheduled at 8 am was lacking in all the above. I was extremely thirsty. I used the call bell but nobody came. I personally requested the attendant who was passing by. He said that he will do the needful in a jiffy but that jiffy took about 20 minutes. Except for one or two, the rest of the staff was rude and straight-faced. When my friend requested for a second can of beer, the hostess after having much arrogance on her face said that they will provide for the same after they have served all the passengers. No problem! But then when asked for it again, she said that their policy does not allow them for the same. Though later she brought the glass of beer. Is this the way the hospitality industry works? I have been in innumerable flights- international as well as domestic , but never ever have i seen such arrogance and rude display of behaviour. As far as the entertainment part is concerned, the list of movies and programmes was limited and outdated. It was difficult to pass the seven hours in the flight.
I do not recommend the airlines.

Title:
This was an AF flight that was filled by MK. Unfortunately, this was the only flight that I could find that would fit my schedule. Here are my gripes:
MK behaves like it is not affiliated to AF. I am a Platinum medallion member which is honored by AF. However, MK does not offer the same treatment on this AF flight. The check in was handled by MK and there were no Sky priority lines, no indication that this was an AF partner flight, and no support for frequent flyers apart from the Kestrel program.

The online check-in was even more confusing... the checkin form appears to have been populated with inaccurate information and my initial check in failed. Apparently the usual US month / day represention does not translate well to the Euro / MRU day / month format. After making the change, I also had problems with the loyalty information - did not allow my skymiles id to be entered. Finally, the boarding pass did not have any information that would indicate that I have priority boarding and access to airport lounges.

All those problems are simple usability problems that can be easily fixed but I am not holding my breath.

I do not usually bring my Skymiles Platinum loyalty card as all those info are on my mobile app. I was fortunate that I brought that card for this trip as MK could not help at all here. I had to flash that card and explain my priority status to every airline staff because this info was nowhere to be found on the original checkin boarding pass issued by MK.

I also have the same complaint for baggage. I had to ask to have the priority tag set on my lugguage.

Finally, the checkin schedule - had to show up 3 hrs before flight because there is no priority processing. As a frequent flyer, airports are not holiday spots and I would rather have spent an additional hour or two in vacation mode elsewhere.

However, in order to ensure that i get to my final destination - of which MK was only 1 of the legs, I had to bite the bullet and spend the time and effort to get all the paperwork documented. Additional stress that i did not plan.

What a mess!

Used to be a great airline with friendly and courteous staff. Has gone down significantly. Try other airlines if you want a positive experience for your vacation.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
Loved flying in the new Air Mauritius A330-900 Neo. It was very comfortable, with lots of leg room and wide, comfortable seats.

The leg room was not compromised with the seat in front of me fully reclined either (I am 6' foot tall, and the person in the seat in front of me was 6'7"!).

The entertainment on offer was of a good standard, with a large touch screen with multiple options (movies, TV shows, music, radio, games, map, etc.). One great feature was in the upgraded flight map where there were a couple of camera views - one of what was in front of the plane, and one of below, which was brilliant to see what you were flying over.

The onboard food and drinks were lovely, with real metal cutlery.

With a stowed /checked-in baggage allowance of more than 30kg there was not much need to have a large carry on.

All in all a very pleasant flight, through which I slept for a large portion (something that rarely happens on flights).

Title:
We flew Air Mauritius in Business Class from DEL-MRU and back. While flying from DEL to MRU (MK745), the crew was fabulous and we enjoyed the customer service. The seats were comfortable and food was ok.

However, the nightmare started on our way back from Mauritius. Our 2 year old's nanny was also flying with us, but in the economy class as it was a last minute booking for her and the business class was already full. Since the baby is very attached to his nanny, almost inseparable from her (as my wife and I are both working), we needed her for a short time in business class only to feed the baby and put him to sleep (so that its peaceful and quiet for others too). However, the crew was absolutely unhelpful this time, with Karuna Dhahal leading the crew! They literally fought with us to prevent the nanny from taking care of the baby at his seat in business class, giving all sorts of illogical excuses. Yes, we had paid for a separate seat for the baby, so its not that she was getting in anyone's way! We understand that airlines have Standard Operating Procedures and we appreciate that, but all that we wanted was for the nanny to feed the baby, put him to sleep and then of course, go back to her actual seat, just the way she did on our journey from DEL - MRU. It took us several minutes of heated arguments with the woman in charge to finally concede to our request when the baby got very cranky without the nanny as it was past his bedtime! Eventually, the nanny didn't even spend 10% of the flight time in the business class as the baby was asleep the rest of the overnight journey.

What was more shocking than anything else was that when we told Karuna Dhahal that her colleagues on the DEL-MRU sector went out of the way to accommodate the nanny in the business class for a few minutes, she responded unabashedly saying that her colleagues didn't do their job properly!!!!!

The nightmare for us didn't end there. My wife is a vegetarian and when asked for dinner options, she clearly stated her choice. However, they served her with chicken salad for appetisers and then, instead of apologising, they again argued with us! It seems like the staff hasn't been trained around sensitivities regarding vegetarian vs non-vegetarian diet in India, even when so many people from India travel to Mauritius daily and majority of Hindus don't eat chicken.

Please note that we didn't experience any of these issues in the DEL-MRU flight where the crew was extremely nice and understanding. We know one thing for sure, we loved Mauritius and if we were to ever travel to the country again, we would hope and pray while booking our tickets that we don't get Karuna Dhahal on any of the flights!
qwuub: Customer service in business class was a nightmare
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
3 days prior to our departure to Mauritius, my father passed away. We were forced to change our travel by 3 days to allow for the funeral. Air Mauritius, however would not wave the ticket change fee without a certified copy of the death certificate, my birth certificate and my marriage certificate to prove I was married to my wife who I was travelling with – all within 3 days of my father passing away. We received no compassion from the staff on the contact centre , in Mauritius and were told if we paid for the ticket change fees we could not challenge them. In Australia, it takes over a week to obtain the death certificate – in this case it took 10 days and we were already in Mauritius. Once in Mauritius, we even went to the head office in Port Louis but again despite promises of review, no change ticket change fee refund was granted and no reason given for the denial of our request.
ON return to Australia, we tried again locally and although we received one call and one email, nobody has contacted us since.

Title:
This complaint is based on the service received from Air Mauritius South Africa - departing and arrival - service from Mauritius side is excellent.
1. We travel with a cerebral palsy person and a disabled person and request in advance the bulkhead seating which we are informed cannot be booked in advance. Reason for this advance booking is the cerebral palsy person needs 100% assistance and needs to be carried to the seat as the airline wheelchair does not work as he cannot hold himself up and trying to carry him to the back of the plane doesnt work either. Plus his legs do not bend at a 90 degree angle nor do they straighten properly nor can he hold himself up so surely the airline should be compassionate and have better ways of dealing with these situations
2. The Manager in 2018 screamed at us to hurry up and get on the plane even though i understood that disabled are meant to be boarded first but was not done and hence the manager screaming at us, across the passage, over other passengers.
3. 2019 trip and the same manager on duty who informs us we have upset his passengers by asking for the bulkhead seats and have caused hassles.
I am appalled that he can treat people like this, especially people who need a bit of extra help. Being told that disabled must sit at the back of the plane is not the correct way in dealing with this and having told him to maybe have a bit of compassion was a complete waste of time. We plan on flying in 2020 again and i dread what sort of service we will receive from this manager again.
I do not understand why the bulkhead seats couldnt be booked in advance - there were other travellers, who were able bodied - and they had booked these seats (i will note in 2018 and 2019).
What must we do to avoid this disgusting service again come 2020 as i dread what will happen the third time round.
4.Arriving back in SA our personal wheelchair and electric scooter was left outside in the rain and was delivered to us sopping wet - no consideration for the person using the chair or the fact that the scooter is electric and very expensive and was getting wet.
Why with so many calls and emails to Air Mauritius did they not offer other options - only response was you cannot book the seats until the day of the flight and even then we receive terrible service.

Title:
On the 31st of March 2019, my family and I had the misfortune of being booked to fly (or not fly as the case actually was) on MK843 back to Cape Town.

We arrived (my wife and I and our two children aged 7 and 9) after being transported from Club Med La Pointe Canonniers at the airport around 1pm on Sunday afternoon to be informed that the expected departure of 16:15 was delayed to 18:25. That time arrived but there was still no sight of the plane or any information being relayed by the departure gate staff in terms of what could be expected in terms of departure time. At that stage, there was no indication of when we would fly and very little information from the departure gate staff (in terms of what was causing it, bar from a vague excuse that the technical team are attending to it) only to be told that the next update will be provided at 19:30. Roll on 19:30 and yet so information.

In the interim, meal vouchers were provided for the Tropical Break takeaway kiosk for a choice of either cold fried rice or fried noodles as the only options which was completely cold and inedible with the takeaway kiosk being unable to cope with the mass of people with only one microwave on site to heat the food on offer.

Just after 8pm that evening, after spending seven hours at the airport we were told that flight MK843 was cancelled and that the flight would be rescheduled and that hotel accommodation would be provided to travellers. In the normal course of events, that would have been fine but the incompetence and complete lack of customer care that followed completely destroyed the relaxation that was achieved whilst holidaying in Mauritius for the past 11 days which will likely result in my family and I never ever flying Air Mauritius ever again or perhaps ever considering Mauritius as a holiday destination again.

After going through customs we were directed to a single kiosk where only two ground staff assisted to help 200 irate passengers find suitable accommodation for the evening. We were assigned to the Peninsula Hotel which we were happy about as it was only 16 mins away from the airport, but that joy shortly dissipated when we arrived at the hotel to be told by reception that we were in fact not assigned to that specific hotel as another airline’s cancelled flight was already booked in an hour prior to ours (this was apparently a mistake that was made by Air Mauritius ground staff). We continued to spend another 90 mins at that hotel waiting to hear from Air Mauritius in terms of what the next option was going to be. By this time, we were extremely tired (especially our seven and nine year old children) as we had been in transit for more than 12 hours now. Eventually, close to midnight, we were informed that Air Mauritius had found alternative accommodation but that it was close to 90 minutes away on the east coast. We had no option but to accept this and endured the long drive to Long Beach resort to arrive well after 1am in the morning, only to be woken at 4:30am to catch the same bus back to the airport to catch the replacement flight that would leave Mauritius 9:30am the next morning.

I find the lack of information, complete incompetence and lack of customer care unacceptable during this whole process. How does one book close to 50 passengers into a hotel that has already been booked by another airline?? And secondly, how do you make travellers wait for seven hours at an airport before making the call to actually cancel the flight??

qwuub: 7 hour wait for flight to be cancelled and poor customer service

Title:
Ok, I tried to think of the good points of our flight, but to be honest, there wern't really any. The view out of the window at 37,000ft was interesting, but that's about it.

Where to start?

Overnight trip, so wasn't planning on doing much, have dinner, maybe a drink, but mostly sleep. Now I haven't flown Air Mauritius before, so I did check out the reviews before we left, and obviously I wasn't expecting much. To be honest, it was prwtty grim.

The plane was ancient. Air mauritius have only 12 aircraft in their fleet, and the three A340's which service the European routes were all built between 1994 and 1999. They are a quarter of a century old! Meaning the A340 we were on had close to 40 million miles under its wings and about 35,000 landing cycles. And it shows. It had ash trays! I'll just let that one sink in for a minute. Actual ash trays! The interior was just worn out. The seats were cramped and not suitable for a 12 hour flight. I'm used to long haul but this was just awful. The IFE was a joke. Not on-demand, a tiny low-res screen and no sound. Good thing I was planning to sleep for most of the flight.

Food was only just ok. Drinks were better, but only one service, I had to go the galley and ask for another glass of wine. The breakfast was inedible.

Cabin crew were ok, one was really friendly, the others just looked a bit tired and clearly didn't want to be there.

The tickets were cheap. You literally get what tou paid for. A plane that goes to Mauritius. That's it! Forget anything else.

It's cheap for a reason.

Title:
We travelled as a group of 8 people from Cape Town to Mauritius. We used Air Mauritius for both trips.

Cape Town to Mauritius:
1. The flight was delayed by two hours and no one could explain why.
2. The blankets and pillows that were provided smelled absolutely awful.
3. The food that was served on board did not look or smell good. Most of us did not eat the food. The two people in out group that ate the food had stomach problems for the next 24 hours.
4. The air hostesses were the only positive aspect about that flight. They were friendly, helpful and polite.

Mauritius to Cape Town:
1. We arrived at the airport and our flight was on schedule. We checked our luggage in and the lady at the counter informed us that the flight was going to be delayed but she was unsure how long it would be delayed and it would be best if we just waited at the gate.
2. We received our boarding passes and it stated that we must board at gate 24. We waited at gate 24.
3. The flight information board then changed to say that we are boarding at gate 26.
4. We then moved to gate 26 waiting to board.
5. The flight information board then changed again and stated that the flight will be delayed by 4 hours and we are to board at gate 19.
6. We were then informed that they were suddenly an airplane short and that was the reason for the delay.

We are still waiting to board the flight.

Title:
Air Mauritius is terrible. The seats have barely enough leg room for a toddler, the in-flight entertainment is worse than a publicly funded TV channel and the air-conditioning is a foreign concept, with no vents above any seats at all. I have flown all over the world in both business and economy, and I have never been in a plane as bad as an air Mauritius plane. I have been on domestic China flights that are just as bad if not better than this. I will refuse to come to Mauritius again due to this airline, 13 hours with Air Mauritius is worse than 3 flights with 4 stop overs totalling over 30 hours of flying. I feel for the staff who have to deal with such a poor working environment. After facing massive delays at Mauritius’ main airport due to a conveyor belt malfunction, causing us to wait in a long line for 2 hours and the whole plane to be delayed, as soon as we finally boarded the plane and were on the runway ready to take off, an urgent malfunction happened to occur causing us to return to the gate for what will most likely be a long time. I’m not sure how long it will be as I am writing this review as I wait, with no aircon, drinks or inflight entertainment, but I am pretty certain it won’t be quick….

Quick update 2 hours in. The inexperienced captain has provided two options. Disembark and unload the whole plane and move to another one or wait another 1-2 hours (probably 3-4 since time is also a foreign concept to this airline) for the problem to be fixed. I will now miss my interconnecting flight. This airline has single handedly ruined my holiday at the start and has done the same to the end. This holiday has been nothing but trouble and this airline was the number one cause. Save yourself the trouble. Don’t go to Mauritius. Go to Fiji or another tropical place that is the exact same and save yourself time, money and a terrible flight experience.

Another update, the captain informed us, after sitting in the plane at the gate for one and a half hours that we will now disembark and enter another plane, which started off as a one hour process. Less than a minute later we are told by the same captain, the one with no knowledge, will now be an hour and a half.

Title:
We had a flight from CT to Mauritius (25th December) and then back Mauritius to CT (1st January). we had mixed experiences on both legs, below are some of the issues:
1) For me overall standard, nothing special
2) On the CT-MR leg, there were three people dealing with the one flight (one was business class). check in time was un-necessarily long
3) On the flight to MR it was a new flight but legroom seemed to be an issue. the person behind me either had his legs protruding beneath my seat or int he isle
4) The seats generally hard, same for the return flight which was an older plane (more below)
5) the iphone app is okay but not great. does not always remember your details. on the return flight for example i had to re-enter all the passport details etc even though did it on the flight to MR?
6) Most international flights open 48 hours before for check in, AMR does not seem to. the App did not tell you this just said does not recognize the PRN no?
7) Service on the flight to MR was standard and i may be mistaken but am sure the attendant pulled her nose up when i asked for two cups of water (before they came around to serve)
8) On the flight CT to MR, take off is at 10pm, only one meal served on the flight
9) In terms of the kids, they received kids meals and packs which was welcome
10) on the return flight MR - CT the food service was somewhat chaotic and at one point we noticed an attendant from further in front of the plane served people he knew and as it turned out people in between were missed out!
11) on the return leg, we were meant to fly out at 4:15pm but received notification around 8am to say flight delayed. I did inquire but was not given a reason at check in why the delay. we were then ready to board at the allocated time of 6:30pm and the check in attendants were there only to be told past 6:30pm poiint that the gate had changed. this late into the game? needeless to say there was confusion as to what was priority boarding etc but the captain managed to get us to land on time despite taking off 30mins late
12) one thing other airlines do with AMR should is priority boarding for families (with young children)
13) Inflight entertainment had more varierty on the CT-MRU flight (newer plane, touch screen etc) and the return flight which had fixed time slots with fewer options.

Great for a direct flight CT to MR and back, but be prepared.

My family and I booked this trip 5 months ago to celebrate our 24th wedding anniversary. The tickets booked were business class and paid in FULL..

We were meant to depart on MK854 on 16 Dec at 2am and arrive in Mauritius at 8:30am. The main reason for booking such an early flight was to spend an extra day on this beautify island. I had arranged an early check in with the hotel management.

On Fri 8pm 14 Dec, I received a message that this flight will be delayed to 15:00 on 16 Dec (13 hour delay).
On 15 Dec I tried to call the airline several times but they were clueless and unhelpful. Three time they put the phone down on me. Eventually I wrote them an email but received NO response.

On 16 Dec (day of our departure), at 9am I received a message that online check in was open. I tried several times to do so but was bombed out.
At 10am we received a call informing us that the updated 3 pm flight was now rescheduled to depart at 16:20. This represented now a total of 14.5hr in delays. In addition, we have been downgraded to Economy. She gave us one option and that was to take a 1:25pm flight which was 3hours earlier than the dreaded MK854. We literally scrambled to make our way to the airport. My daughter said this was like a scene from the move “Home Alone”.
However, even on this flight we would be unable to fly economy as it was overbooked.

In all of the above, I lost both my airport transfers and incurred additional costs to make alternative transport arrangements.

In summary:
- lost one day in Mauritius (TIME)
- downgraded from Business to Exonomy (INCONVENIENCED)
- new transfer (COSTS)
- STRESS (EMOTIONAL)

We are the kind of travelers that book in advance, arrive early so that we are not stressed but based on the above, everything that went wrong went wrong.

The sad reality is that I am still waiting an official response from Air Mauritius.
The local travel agent in Mauritius himself said that he would never recommend this airline.
In my 20 trips, most of which flown on SAA or BA, I have never experienced, My WORST airline travels EVER.

At the time of writing I am yet to be responded to or reimbursed for my downgrade.
qwuub: The most shocking experience in 20 trips to Mauritius

Title:
I had booked a flight to Mauritius from Delhi for myself and my wife

Initial travel dates – 26th November 2018 – Morning 8 AM to 2nd December 2018 Evening 9 PM. Direct flights

Received an email just a week ago from Yatra team, (Air Mauritius team not generous enough to inform that there is any change)

That the flight has been preponed to 25th November and 2nd December morning instead of the initial schedule.

All my bookings were from 26th and the team just informs a week ago about this change

After trying to reach the customer care, which was another tedious task, and fighting for almost 2 days, the trip got planned for 25th November evening, but through a connecting flight with a lay over of 6 plus hours in Mumbai

In the expectations of not modifying the bookings for stay, I thought to go ahead with the proposed change

However, Air Mauritius team had separate plans

At 25th November evening, when I had already left for the Airport from my house, I received a phone call from your team regarding a further change and delay in flight. Now the lay over was for nearly 17 hours. And the intimation had been given so late that nothing could be done

I asked the team to kindly assist at the airport. The team provided me an email confirmation that as soon as we would reach Mumbai airport, somebody would provide the accommodation without delay



After reaching Mumbai airport, that too an hour late as the Air India flight was delayed, Air Mauritius team showed their best hospitality. NOBODY PRESENT AT THE COUNTER TO ASSIST THE CUSTOMERS. DESPITE THE FACT THAT FLIGHT WAS NOW DELAYED FOR 17 HOURS, THERE WAS NOT A SINGLE PERSON TO ASSIST

We contacted the airport staff to let us out so that we could arrange an accommodation on our own, but they mentioned only the Air Mauritius team could let us out of the Airport due to security reasons. But the team was probably sleeping at that time



The team arrived at the counters at 3 AM, though the initial time of arrival should have been much earlier

After another fight, the team made arrangements for the stay at a nearby hotel



Even the next day, the flight had taken off after a further delay of another hour



Monetary loss faced -



Reaching Mauritius at midnight (Indian time). All the cabs which we had booked initially had gone because of the delays made in the arrival. Had to find another cab at a much higher price

One day of stay totally lost

All activities of the first day which had been a part of the itinerary lost and had to be paid for again on other days

Till today waiting for the team to respond

Title:
We flew in business class to Mauritius, a bit of a treat really and one of the problems resulting from using business class for business flights!

The highlight of air Mauritius is their friendly and polite cabin crew. It is so refreshing to see a friendly and attentive crew. This makes up for the few shortfalls which would have otherwise resulted in a 1 star rating (for business class).

The shortfalls:
- The bed is not flat. It is at an angle which meant that one is prone to sliding down. -The flights were overnight 13 hours so this was an important issue.
- The media facility was a little outdated and felt old. Nevertheless, the space and cleanliness was excellent and at least the media worked!
- I could not have my meal choice as there was none left. Whilst a risk in economy I consider this as unacceptable in business class (please remind me what the airfares were again?!🤔).

Whilst the shortfalls don’t mean I won’t fly Business Class with this airline again we will defiantly search out alternatives.

Title:
I actually flew with Mauritius Airways in August 2016 when I went on my honeymoon but have only just got round to writing the review.

I'll start with the positive. The check in process was quick, efficient and the staff we dealt with were very, very friendly, and we chose Mauritius Airways because at the time, it was the only option to fly direct. The other option was Emirates via Dubai but that put a good 4-5 hours on the journey time. The flight was on time, and we also got given a little personal hygiene kit including a tooth brush and a few other bits, which was a nice touch. The food was also ok as far as airline food goes.

That's where the good stuff ends I'm afraid.

Firstly, for a long haul flight, there wasn't a lot of leg room. It's the least I've ever had for a flight over 6 hours. The interior of the plane was a bit old and tired, and it wasn't particularly comfortable. But, the biggest thing was the in flight entertainment. The flight was advertised with a selection of films, hence I left my books in my checked in luggage. The Entertainment systems were the old-school screens you used to get in the late 80's and hadn't been updated, which in itself wasn't the end of the world, but 2 thirds of them (including mine) didn't work. The screen didn't even turn on. My wife's did, but there were about 15 channels that didn't run on demand, but simultaneously, so when they reset the system every half an hour (as they did for the first 4 hours) everyone watching a film had to start again. The passengers were getting angry and it was obviously a long standing problem as the crew were well drilled in dealing with the complaints. After dealing with about 200 angry passengers, the cabin crew just vanished, obviously wanting to avoid the conflict and this went on for about 3 hours, in which time we couldn't even get a drink.

In summary, I had paid for a seat with in flight entertainment which I didn't get. I complained several times and got nothing more than "sorry". 13 hours is a long flight with nothing more than the safety card to entertain you.
crvsd: Adi B wrote a review Oct 2018

Title: Our fight from Johannesburg to Mauritius was good with the new aircraft we had inflight entertainment and individual screens which was great. The food was ok however I do recommend kids book child meals as the standard meal was fairly spicy. Staff were always very friendly and the kids are spoiled with goodie bags with lots of fun things to do and souvenirs to keep. Coming back to Johannesburg however was disappointing as the aircraft was old with very limited space between each seat. The person in front reclined and I had my tray basically on my lap. No individual screens or entertainment and none of our headsets worked. The arrival times in Mauritius are horrible. Immigration is very slow. We arrive at the hotels just before dinner closes at 10pm or sometimes even after if you coming from a shuttle which has dropped guests elsewhere first. Departure times from Mauritius are equally horrific. Those on shuttles have to leave the hotels by 5am which means they up around 4am. Private transfers or taxis in this case are better to leave hotels at 6am to be at the airport by 7am. Departure time is way too early and a major disappointment for people visiting the island as they lose time on the first and last day.

Title:
We have flown Air Mauritius to Mauritius for some years now. The earlier flights were satisfactory with cabin crews that were very attentive, and good food. The two constant complaints have been that in Business Class the seats are not fully flat, resulting in slippage down . And the in flight entertainment is well below the standard of other airlines. But overall an OK experience.
However our last trip in July/August was a poor experience for our family party of 10 including 4 young children. On the flight out they had no food for two of the children in spite of it being pre booked. The cabin crew member was abrupt when this was brought to her unfortunately attention, and eventually brought two adult meals which were still partially frozen!

The food in Business Class is now not as good as it was in our earlier flights, overall not the same standard or variety.

On check in for the return flight the family booked in Economy had to queue right at the back instead of priority boarding despite another family being allowed to board early

On the return flight my wife and I had precooked the seats together but were separated on different rows. After complaining about this we were eventually reseated together.

The rest of the family were in Economy and two adults and two children were not in their pre booked seats and had been relocated to the back row with non reclining seats to accommodate another family who wanted to sit together.

The cabin crew on the return flight did their best to recover the situation but the family experience was a poor one

Air Mauritius have bought new planes with fully flat seats, and our travel agent was told they would be in service to Mauritius, but instead they were in service elsewhere.

Unfortunately Air Mauritius will not be our first choice of airline to Mauritius in the future
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Business class on the outward journey was delightful - huge arm chair-like seats widely spaced in the cabin, incorporating a massage option and various seat positions. The cabin staff were immaculate, and served us a carton of tropical fruit drink during the 30 minute flight. Economy on the way back was just as pleasant. What fun to be on a flight which begins its descent within 20 minutes of take-off. We had the same pilot/co-pilot on both occasions, and both times they had trouble lining the plane up at the air bridge, so it took almost as long to de-plane as it took for the flight itself, but otherwise a very professional airline.

Title:
Firstly, going to Mauritius from Perth wasn't too much trouble but on the flight back, crew refused to push daughter who can transfer herself from seat to cabin wheelchair.

Expectation was for the crew member to push to the toilet door and back. They cited airline procedures about unable to lift passengers when clearly we explained that wasn't needed. After several minutes of arguing, even the flight purser said the same and even gave the example of another passenger that wasn't allowed fly as she was on her own, comments like disabled people need to travel with a doctor, nurse or carer.

Clearly their training is not adequate and one flight to another, there's inconsistency and you're lucky to fly with the knowledgeable staff who can differentiate between passenger needs and apply correct procedures.

I ended up having to push my daughter with his toddler brother in my arms. The crew told me wasn't medically trained and hence couldn't operate the cabin wheelchair 😂 yet she assumed as a father/carer I had to be trained medically as I had to push the wheelchair onboard an aircraft in flight.

I'd avoid if you have limited mobility, not worth the trouble and drama. Far better airlines to pick from.

Complaint was cookie cutter replies, same citiation of airline procedures aboit lifting, didn't address the conernong fact that parents were asked to manipulate aircraft equipment, especially how unsafe it was to be expected to do so carrying a toddler. Apparently crew told at their investigations that they provided the assistance, clearly saving their interests and not assuming responsibility for their actions, which to me says nothing will change.

Overall, food is average, leg space is too. Customer service depends on who you end up with.

Airport services in Mauritius at the boarding gates and check-in are very good, assistance is provided to push passengers in wheelchairs and to collect luggages and provide priority processing through immigration.
crvsd: Ruben R wrote a review Sep 2018

Title: Well, one seems to think that if you have an island and one airline, you could either be complacent and serve whatever you like or be the absolute best from start to finish.  Being a double platinum flyer of SkyTeam in one year and senator on Star Alliance the same, there are comparisons to make and this is not a blog about a one-time experience. Nobody actually goes out there to give you a bad experience but it usually comes down tom leadership and management.  A good motivated purser on a plane can make a world of difference.Specifically for Air Mauritius it’s a tale of two parts, as we flew Business Class out MK844) and Economy class back.  But here goes…Firstly, the International Lounge in cape Town was not on top form having many outages, such as the coffee machine, which is not the most convenient.  Eggs could possibly be bounced off rubber walls and no staff available.  Either way, a vent, but not Air Mauritius problem at this point.Business Class was truly disappointing.  There was no priority boarding and having asked a staff member, he didn’t even listen and directed us to the Economy Queue.  This is not unusual with airlines when travelling with a family., but it seems Air Mauritius would like to enforce this type of stereotyping.  It doesn’t end there.  Boarding the plane with a family of four in Business Class, after asking where the priority Queue was didn’t get any better.  In actual fact, our 13 year old daughter, who boarded first,  was sent to the Economy section without the steward even looking at her boarding pass.  I had to call her back to row 6.  We got no apology.  The service was way below par and started with myself getting skipped the first drinks service with no apology when complaining.  A simple " what do you want" seems good enough for Business Class passengers.In addition, our choices were out before meal service.  We understand that this could be a common phenomenon on flights but a short flight to Mauritius should cater for most.  Nevertheless, simple service breaches were consistent.  My wife wasn’t feeling well and two hours into the flight pushed the call button.  This button remained on until landing.  Totally ignored by Business Class flight attendants.I must say that the flight was a disappointment and will not be a further choice or recommendation.  To be honest, our economy return flight had more attentive staff and faster service.  It seems that if you want to save a few thousand dollars and are forced to fly economy on air Mauritius, this would be a better choice!  This goes with the exception of my neighbours armrest flying off and landing on my foot. :-) Also note that you can only use your Skyteam Platinum cards for Air Mauritius if you are flying on an Air France Flight, although announcements on the plane include Air France.
qwuub: Dissapointing and Can Do Much Better
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
We booked our holiday to Mauritius through Virgin, who said we would need to travel in Air Mauritius or would have to change somewhere with another airline! We agreed as surely a long haul airline would be good!?

I read some reviews on here and it sounded terrible! I booked exit seats for my husband and I, which were not cheap- about £240 for both of us both ways.

When we boarded the plane, it was obvious it was old because of the decor! Our exit seats were ok- one excellent, the other had part of the emergency door in the way! But ok!

The staff on the plane were friendly enough but it look a long time to get a drink- my tip would be take some drinks with you! They do come round eventually but plastic cups are small and I did feel very dehydrated when I got off the plane!! Food was ok! Had dinner and breakfast as it was a night flight!

The seat was terrible- so uncomfortable!! Worst seat I’ve ever had! And for a 11.5 hour flight it was bad! In flight entertainment was via a very dated system! We didn’t bother and watched a film on iPad!!

The best bit was that when we were about to land, some small drops of water seemed to be coming from somewhere near the emergency door- never seen that before!!

I know Air Mauritius have two new planes but they don’t seem to use them on the London- Mauritius route!

All I’d say is know what you will get! It’s great as it’s direct flight but not a great 11.5 hours of your life believe me!

I sent an email to airlines for a cause of delay but my mail has not been answered.

This has been my worst experience of an international flight.

Title:
Left Perth Sunday the 22nd of July at 2.10 pm.
That is an hour and 5 minutes late.
That can happen to any other airline company.
But then to say we have a slight delay because of refueling !!!!
I don't think so, not a prudent thing to do with 200 people on board and to refuel a plane.
Real reason was they were waiting from a connection flight from Sydney that was running 2 hours late. They should have left us in the lounge area for another hour, as the flight from Sydney or Melbourne is a 4 hour flight they knew this in advance.
No drinks were offered and twice I asked could they at least turn on the movies, but no feedback at all and no movies.
Same with the landing, they collected the headphones 25 minutes before landing, why? Even with your own head phones they did kill the movie 20 minutes before landing.
One a last point, their entertainment system comes out of NOAH's ARC.
I haven't seen a screen like that for at least 12 years at least. If I was the CEO of Mauritius Airlines, I would be embarrassed to have those planes in my fleet.
In case of an emergency there is very little chance of survival between Perth and Mauritius, 9 hour flight. You would want to have a newer aircraft on this route.
I like to finish of saying we had a perfect landing on the island.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
Having flown with Air Mauritius to Malaysia, we also booked flights from Johannesburg to Perth. The 3 hour stop-over in Port Louis gave us a great break and made the journey seem much shorter. 4.5 hours from JNB to MRU and under 6 hours from MRU to PER definitely beats a direct flight of 10 hours

Boarding procedure in JNB was very good but onboard service on the JNB route was average and staff seemed to be rushing to get done. The onboard entertainment system did not function in our seats (4K, 4J), but appeared to be fine for others.

The boarding process in MRU was chaotic but onboard service was good from MRU. This was a night flight so managed to get some sleep and be ready for landing in Perth in the morning.

Flights were priced very well compared with SAA and Qantas - more than 25% saving.

Title:
Here is what happened to us. It was my wife our 1,5 years old daughter and me flying from Norway to Mauritius through Paris. The Airfrance flight form Bergen to Paris was extremely pleasant. Staff members are friendly and they know how to entertain small kids on the aircraft.

The Mauritius airline on the other hand was extremely unprofessional. We ordered Kosher meal while paying for tickets and there weren’t any option to do it for our daughter, so that is why I was chosen just a regular kids meal for her.
Before we took off they showed us our sealed meals, however when the seat belt sign was off I was surprised that we didn’t have our food served. Instead they started to serve those who had vegetarian options. When I kindly asked about our food the lady said the following: different airlines have different rules and right now they serving kids and babies. I pointed on our daughter and she answered madly that it’s on the way and I am gonna have to wait as much as it needs. What a customer service. But ok, I didn’t wanna make a big deal out of it even though all other airlines serve it right away. On the top of that Mauritius airline showed us our food before the take off so the other airlines do as well to Jewish people. Which means that they suppose to follow the rules and they do sometimes I suppose.

Anyway, they served us our food which was the worst Jewish food I ever tried, but they did not served anything to our daughter. When I asked for the food to her - same lady replied that they don’t have kids kosher food, which is a stupid excuse to not to serve her the food at all. I said that I am aware of that, because that’s what I was personally choosing when I was ordering a tickets. She that brought us the food to our daughter, who was hungry and tired as it was midnight and she still didn’t eat anything from our extremely spicy fish and vegetables. This is completely unprofessional and disgusting.

Wait, its not over: when they were collecting the garbage - same lady refuse to take ours because she was taking those who had a tray. OUR boxes had trays(see pictures). At the same time we had one more Jewish who was siting on 18 f seat and the guy who collected a trash from the other side took it from her without any problem.
I though this is unfair and had to go take to someone who was in charge. She apologized and said that she believes me, but at the same time she has to hear other sides of the story. I had nothing else to say and haded to my seat.

Here’s what makes me mad the most: we ordered this trip in March and were very excited about it and that is how it starts...
Mauritius airline is not cheap: I paid $2700 for round trip for my wife, daughter and me in econom class! For example, last year I flew with Cathay Pacific to Hong Kong for only $2000 round trip. Both the service, food and seats were way better. In Mauritius airline you can not chose a movie or songs and start it from the beginning besides those 4 which is already playing.
The screen size of the TV is a little bit bigger than my Ipnone! Restrooms are dirty and it’s super hot on the plain. Plus the plain was made in 1980 or so, because they have a ash trashes all over the place: in the restrooms and in the each seat handle.

I will never ever fly with Mauritius airlines again and do not recommend to do that to anyone who respect themselves. Chose instead: KLM, AirFrance, Cathay Pacific, Emirates, Korean or even Thai airlines, but avoid this one. How one person can ruin the entire Arline reputation?! Unbelievable.
qwuub: If you are Jewish avoid at all cost.

Title:
It all started on the 27th of June when my parents were due to depart from Cape Town they were delayed for 12 hours and hence they missed their first day and had to claim from travel insurance for the day that they lost it wasn't all bad though because they are arrived in at night instead of wasting a day sleeping when they arrived early in the morning so that is at least not so bad however I was stressing when my sister and her husband and my partner and I we left on the 4th of July and we thought that perhaps the same thing was due to happened but it didn't so lucky for us.

So my terrible review of the airline start yesterday the 8th of July we were due to depart at 16:15 we told at the check-in counter that the flight is delayed by 1 hour which happens you know it's it's not anybody's fault but it was the same reason it was the operational reason which means that the other the other aircraft did not arrive for the other destination in time. it starts with the fact that it's school holidays which is nobody's fault however there were about 500 kids, babies in fact that were due to fly on same flight not only were an hour delayed, but while we waiting to board again we were told that it was a further 20 minute delay, so we sat in amongst irritated tired kids.

So here we are sitting on a 5 1/2 hour flight with about 6 screaming babies they did not stop Then tire 5 and a half hours again nobody's fault because it does happen and we did have a bit of turbulence on a flight so their ears could have been quite sore.

My issue now starts with a airline staff I was told in Cape Town when I bought a bottle of vodka that as long as the the bag stay sealed that over be no problem for me to carry it back from Mauritius in my hand luggage because I was really scared that the bottle neck was going to break only to be told that I can't because no liquids more than Hundred Mills are allowed in hand luggage so that's was the first issue that I had is that the communication between airports and the duty-free is not consistent.

And then we were met with the most wonderful (read sarcasm here) airline staff on Air Mauritius they were the most rude and unhelpful staff I have ever come across. it took them over an hour to serve the first drink, then another hour to serve food and they didn't have enough of the one meal and both of the meals were spicy so if you have an issue like my mother does with spicy food, she didn't eat. I pushed the overhead button 7 Times nobody came to see why I pushed the button even though I was only asking for another drink because I was thirsty, they never came and then when she did come she said to me: did you push the button? I said yes I did, she promptly pushed the button off and walked away didn't even ask me why I had pushed the button.

And then it comes to the width of the aisles, when there's somebody standing waiting from the toilet or to the toilet, they just refused to Move while they were serving on the Trolley even though she was close enough to just move 2 rows out of the way, but just refused to do it and then we had the headset collection about 20 minutes before we were due to land it was ripped out of my hand, I'm not gonna lie they were extremely aggressive and extremely rude I would never in my life recommend this airline again.

I know that we don't have a lot of airline options from South Africa to Mauritius but I will have to be hard pressed and think long and hard before I give this any recommendation to any of my clients.

I've been working in travel industry for over 15 years and this is by far the worst experience and service I've had on an airline and the fact is they take no accountability for it because who cares, fly somebody else.

Title:
I recently flew to Mauritius for the first time and chose the national carrier even though they were not the cheapest option at the time of booking. I was really looking forward to this flight. The journey over I had seat 35G and was in the last third of the plane, an Airbus A340. I was alarmed at how little leg room I had. My knees touched the magazine holder of the seat in front and there was a metal box under that seat which cut the space for my feet by half. The box contains the electronics for the seat back entertainment system, which in my case did not work the entire flight for either films or music! The food was below average but you should not go hungry. The crew were nice and alcohol was served. This was one of the most uncomfortable long haul flights I have ever had (11h 50m).
The journey back I had 17G, also an Airbus A340. I was alarmed by how much space I actually had! I could almost stretch horizontal, plus there was no under seat box. The seat back screen was the smallest I have ever seen, smaller than my mobile phone. I could not watch any films at all but I did have music, eventually. The food was below average, the crew were nice and alcohol was served. If I had to rate I would say going over 1* and coming back 3*.
qwuub: I really wanted to like this airline

Title:
The addition of a new A350 Airbus to the Air Mauritius fleet makes this airline a delight to fly to and fro Johannesburg with. Onboard wifi was fast and reliable which allows to either continue to work while in the air, or remain connected to your social media.

The air hostesses were very friendly and accommodating, however, service on board the flight was slightly slow and disorganised. The menu is traditional of any Air Mauritius flight, usually a choice between a tasty chicken curry or fish. The beverage service was very slow.

Title:
NB: I am only writing this now. However, it is for flight taken during August 2017.
The in-flight entertainment was very poor. On the London to Mauritius journey: the movie was on a "rolling tape" so you could not rewind the movie- you just had to watch it whenever you pressed the play button. The screen was also very small.
Food was okay, but not great.
In between Supper and Breakfast there was no offer of any drinks or snacks. If you wanted a drink (no snacks was available) then you had to go the back to the area where the food/ drink was stored. It was a very long flight (11.5hrs) - surely the staff could have come around with drinks and snacks later in the flight as not everyone was asleep.
The breakfast was served 1.5hrs before landing - this time was not appropriate to feed the whole plane. By the time we got the meal, 15 minutes later it was time to clear up. Surely they could have started serving the breakfast earlier if time was a factor.
Staff - were not friendly, very tired and grumpy looking.
Overall, furniture of the plane looked nackered and in need of modernisation.
I was told not to stand or talk in the foyer between economy and 1st class as I was disturbing the 1st class passengers (despite whispering). I told the staff that I had also paid for my flight so I am entitled to stand and stretch my legs in the foyer and that we were whispering and taking into consideration of the other passengers.
Overall: a terrible flight and airline!!! Trust me the flights are not cheap!!!
The check-in service at the boarding gate was free for all queque - no organisation!

Title:

Title:
Approximately 4 weeks before we were due to fly out from Mumbai to Mauritius (we had bought our tickets before), we got to know that our return flight to Bombay was cancelled. Makemytrip on which we had booked were of no help to us. We therefore contacted Air Mauritius in Mumbai. They offered to book us on the MRU-BOM flight a day before or after, but since our accommodations in Mauritius had been booked, we could not change the date. They therefore rerouted us and booked us from MRU-Delhi, and then on a connection from Delhi-BOM. I was travelling with my parents, both in their 70s, so I emailed Air Mauritius in Mauritius with a cc to the Bombay office, asking for an upgrade as this is the least they could do. After all, why should senior citizens have to travel an extra 6 hours with a change of airport for no fault of their own? Till date (it has been 2 months), there has been no reply from Air Mauritius. When I spoke to Air Mauritius at Bombay airport for an upgrade before sending the mail, they indicated that they were as it is doing me a favour by offering to put us on a direct flight on a different day! What about our hotel bookings? When I asked if they would pay for the cancellation so that we could fly on a different day, they said no. So basically, we are the ones losing out.We met someone who had also been rerouted and he was upgraded for his trouble, so why weren't we? At least my elderly parents should have been, if not me.

When we asked about duty free allowances etc, considering that we were switching from an International to a Domestic Terminal in Delhi, I got differing answers from the 2 different Air Mauritius Bombay offices. I finally had to look up the net and try to figure it out for myself. BTW, switching terminals was a nightmare in Delhi - don't ever do that if you can help it.

If Air Mauritius was not the only airline flying directly from Bombay to Mauritius, I would not fly it again.
qwuub: Did not put the customer's needs first
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.
