Title:
02DEC2017. MRU/DEL MK744

I was transferred to Air Mauritius by Air Seychelles due Air Seychelles’s flight was cancelled. Arrived at the airport @ 1915 2 hours before departure. Upon check-in, the supervisor approached me asking if I was willing to give up my seat if necessary, because of their flight was oversold. I said ‘Yes’ though I had not listened to what he offered me, such as providing accommodation, compensation..,,,,etc.

Around 2020, the supervisor came to me giving me back the same boarding pass, telling me that they did not need my assistance. He offered me to go to the lounge. Access yonlounge’ was written on the boarding pass.

How can I go to the lounge within such a short rushing hour! I dashed to the immigration immediately. There were long queues for immigration clearance. Though I asked the queue controller if I could use the special channel as I had less than one hour! She said, “Everyone is like you!” So, I said nothing more but lining up.

I arrived at the boarding gate 10 minutes before departure! The gate still opened! Thanks God!

Air Mauritius should assist me to go thru immigration! I was like a frying ant on a hot pan! I raised concerns to Air Mauritius but no answer!

I know what should I do when the same recurrence comes next time!

Title:
3 hrs before we were due to depart we received a text from Air Mauritius saying there’s a 10 hour delay. This resulted in us losing an evening & nights accommodation at our all inclusive holiday.
At Perth airport 2 female senior flight attendants were extremely rude, patronising and sarcastic, (other staff were polite and apologetic). It seems due to technical difficulties they changed the aircraft and the pilot in Perth was not qualified to fly this airplane. There were copies of a letter from Air Mauritius for passengers for insurance purposes, the letter was inaccurate which I pointed out to the 2 attendants they said cross it out and change it.......that’s professional & I’m sure the insurers would not accept that. In the departure lounge the Manager came to see us & felt he needed to explain the situation again. It stated some passengers had been notified the night before yet some had only received a text 3 hrs prior to the original departure time.
Once boarded due to the change of aircraft our seats we’d selected online were not in the same position as before, so instead of being near the back of the craft in a block of 3 we were in the middle 4seats.
It was quite obvious some passengers were given preferential treatment and many were moved around to other seating.
Other noteable issues were:
1) The food was the worst flight food we’ve ever had, neither of us ate hardly anything. This was the same for outbound and inbound flights. Evening meal was chicken......this was very poor quality chicken I would not have fed my dog! Cake was so dry it was hard to swallow, the tea is best described as warm sweet water. Breakfast was worse, a slab of pizza which could be described as dried bread laden with salt, again inedible.
2) The entertainment screen picture was very poor, it was dark & grainy. The touch screen was temperamental.
3) The headphones were of such low grade that when trying to watch anything on the entertainment screen you needed the volume extremely high & even then it was still inaudible.
4) Inability to stretch both legs out due to a large black box under the seat in front.
5) Bruised knees from the seating layout.
All in all this was the worst airline we have flown with and due to their manner, behaviour, inconsistency with each passenger alike, poor quality equipment and food we would not recommend them to anyone.
crvsd: Steveandjulie H wrote a review May 2018

The flight was severely delayed due to “operational reasons”. Just an ordinary flight, nothing special
Boarding completed 20 mins ahead of scheduled flight time, very efficient. Unfortunately, our departure was delayed due to technical inspection and a long queue of airplanes departing ahead of our flight.

The stewardess was very polite, good attitude & smiley. Snacks & drinks were served soon after the plane stabilizing on the air. Lunch was served around 3pm+. I have noticed the serving size shrinking over the years, and there was more rice than dishes. However, MUR food quality still has to improve. Drinks were constantly served. There were one incident when the plastic cups felt over my shoulder while stewardess were pushing the carts. Fortunately, there were empty cups, but they could have been more careful.

The legroom is rather small and seats were not as comfortable as Emirates, Thai Airways or Cathay, and I am only 5 ft 2. I have noticed the shrinkage of seats & legroom over the years for MUR flight. No entertainment system on my flight

Overall, this flight experience is consistent with MUR quality, but it could be been better, considering the points mentioned earlier, especially the seat width & legroom. I fully understand profitability is important, but over cutting on all these factors, will cost MUR customers' experience over a longer term. Though I am a loyal MUR supporter, I might switch to other airlines just for these reasons.

Title:
Although it was a long 12 hours flight from Heathrow to Sir Seewoosagur Ramgoolam International Airport in Mauritius on an Airbus A340-300, I have a good flight. We left Heathrow at 20.00hrs and arrived 1155hrs. The online check in was simple and easy. I had seat no 12B which was an aisle seat which I requested.

I arrived at Heathrow Airport, Terminal 4, 3 hours before departure and was the third passenger to checkin my luggages which were within my allowance of 23 KG.
The flight left 30 minutes late which is not bad. It could have been worst but made it in time in Mauritius.

I found the legroom was a bit tight and seat was not great. I have to accept it as I was flying economy. I found the cabin crew very friendly and helpful which are reassuring. The meals were served hot and not unpleasant. There were choices of menus - seafood or chicken. There was not restrictions on drinks. I had 2 Gins and Tonics and a small bottle of white wine with my meal. On the entertainment side there was the latest Blockbuster movies in several languages. I noticed a lot of passengers had iPads and watching their own programs.

I had my own books to read and relaxed on the flight. As on all long haul flights there are queues for toilets. The toilets were reasonably clean. It must be passengers were considerate to other fellow passengers.

On the whole it was a great flight. May be I was lucky. The cabin crew were hard working and very helpful.

I flew back to London on MK42 after 3 weeks. I flew on Airbus A343. We left at 22.00hrs and arrived 06.35hrs. Same thing. No trouble and had a pleasant flight home.

Yes, I would recommend Air Mauritius for its fares and services

Title:
This review is for MK440 however I will also include experiences from MK441 9 days earlier.
My wife and I flew from Perth to Mauritius return for our annual holiday. As usual we booked and paid for business class seating.

Boarding at Perth was a bit of a mix-up with no real organisation to it. It was slightly better in Mauritius on the return trip.

First impressions of the A330/A340 business class cabin was that it looked very good and quite stylish. It looked like a nice place to be for a 7-8 hour flight. It really wasn't.

Service was decidedly average on both flights with a complete mix-up with my wife's meal. Simply not good enough at the price we paid for a premium flight experience.

A couple of things really made me angry:

Just before "top of descent" into Mauritius I had to use one of the two toilets situated at the front of the A340. In over 500 flights and 1.5 million kilometres of flying in the last 15 years I have never seen such a toilet in such a disgusting state. It was appalling.

On the return flight, which was overnight, I had the cabin crew lean over my wife to close my window blind not once but four times. I like to fly with the blind open and when I pay to sit in that window seat I certainly will have it open. I have never had this happen on any flight before and it was only when I got angry that they stopped trying to close it.

As the title says it was an average business class experience. Air Mauritius, in my opinion, is not one of the worlds greatest airlines.

Would I fly with them again? Well, I probably wouldn't be going to Mauritius again not that it isn't a beautiful and amazing country so the likelihood is low. If I were to travel between Perth and Mauritius I would probably look at other flight options.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:

In the 11 years that I have been visiting Mauritius, I can honestly say that your service is progressively getting much worse. MK440 to perth last night. Firstly get a call for parents with children to come to check in first. Go the check in point and everyone (the whole plane) is lining up. If you dont love your job mate, go do something else!
I just wish there was another airline to take for direct flights from Perth. If I can afford it maybe next time take a cheap flight to Malaysia and then catch an Emirates flight to Mauritius just to avoid your sloppy service.

Title: The plane was delayed over 5 hours due to 'operational reasons'.  They notified me the day before and, as I live in Nairobi, I could make alternative plans but many travellers with connecting flights had to hang around the airport for 5 hours more than planned so there was general disgruntlement at the airport when we arrived.  The flight was full and the economy seats were terrible with surely the least amount of legroom legally possible (I haven't checked but it would be most surprising if Air Mauritius is not THE worst of any airline in this respect). VERY uncomfortable to sit for four hours with your knees wide apart and being jolted every time the person in front or behind adjusts his/her seating position. Entertainment was a drop down small screen three rows in front which showed a cartoon movie and then some 'just for laughs' type shorts.  We didn't bother with the headphones on either trip.  Business class looked like the worst business class in the world with old fashioned seats in a 3x3 set up that probably had about 3 inches more legroom than the economy seats.For the return flight, we were allocated extra legroom seats but the seats next to the window are extra thin and at a slant to the floor angle (apparently to make it easier for people to climb over in an emergency) so you can not possibly sit comfortably on them.  I actually had to request to give up my extra legroom seat before the plane took off so that I could occupy a 'normal' seat (there's a first!).  Food was quite good for a short-haul flight (hot) and attendants were fine.  We had one suitcase and one set of golf clubs each and had no additional baggage charges.  I don't care about the entertainment for a short haul flight but I do care about being able to sit reasonably comfortably (I am 6 ft tall so not exactly a giant) so I will avoid using this airline again if at all possible.

It has two classes, business and economy. Economy seat pitch is 31inch which OK kinda of spacing. Much better than air asia which has worlds worst seat pitch of 29inch. Business class has 62 inch.

Checkin desk was slightly slow. Wish the employees did faster job. Not sure if it was because of MK or Air India which had code share and handled operations at BLR/MAA.

Plane is slightly dated, but well maintained. No noises due to its age during flight. Flight attendants were very polite and strictly followed aviation rules. Especially flying out of india and inward people generally dont follow rules like mobile usage, putting the seat straight for take off landing, seat belt for infants and small kids. One of the attendants went a mile ahead and explained one of the parents on importance of seat belt even while on ground in car.

Food and drinks were served on time and I got whatever meal i chose while booking.
Foodwise there wasnt much option though. There was Kocher meals, Hindu (Probably Mauritian/Indian they meant) meals (both veg and nonveg).

Only negative I can say is inflight entertainment. I believe using a personal tab is thousand times better. it had very old screen, dull, devoid of any clarity. there was somewhat decent movie collection though.

Overall decent airliner to flight with all basic facilities available.
BTW there is an option to upgrade to business class after one books economy. It could be a much cheaper way to book business class.

Title:
First a caveat; this airline is due to update its fleet so I expect many aspects of this review will change significantly and for the better.

Contacting the airline to change our allocated seat was very straightforward with helpful and very polite,efficient internet support. Check-in was also smooth and staff very pleasant. Unfortunately there was a significant delay in the departure lounge where the staff either had no idea what was causing the delay or wouldn't tell us. Having had a bad first impression, I was relieved to find that, once on the plane, the cabin crew were delightful and helpful. The food on the flight was probably the best I have ever had in an economy cabin, much better than some reviews I have seen have suggested.

The plane itself was old and tired-looking with very uncomfortable seats and limited legroom for a 12 hour flight - especially when the passenger in front decides to recline their chair fully. Why do airlines use reclining seats in such cramped environments?
The entertainment system was very out-of-date with very small, poor-quality screens. The films play on a loop, so you cannot choose when to see a film or pause it.

On arrival at the other end our baggage arrived intact and together. Although the above looks very critical, as I said, with a fleet update planned, I'm sure it will improve greatly. I will happily fly with Air Mauritius again but would seriously look at upgrading my seat in future, purely because of the length of flight.

Title:
We booked return tickets from Sydney to Mauritius.

We flew virgin aust to Perth with a 1 hour 35 min transfer time, didn't need to transfer to domestic as virgin aust is in same terminal as international airport. Wasn't too concerned with the connection time as they wouldn't sell tickets otherwise.

Needn't have worried in any case, our flight was delayed due to pilot strike in MRU. Credit to the AM ground staff, they were waiting for connecting travellers in the terminal with hand signs, we were told of the delay and were provided with hotel transfer, hotel room and food vouchers.

We were meant to leave at 1.10pm but because of the delay we ended up leaving perth at 11.30pm that night, arrived mauritius 3.30am.

I don't recall much of the flight because I fell asleep 40 mins after boarding, the seats were crampy.

The flight on the way back was better, felt like we had more leg room, the flight was full so my partner had the full aisle seat to himself and I had the 2 seater. Had dinner and breakfast which was okay. The flight crew were friendly and professional.

The flight home was actually cruisy, no turbulence until just reaching Perth and even then it was little.

All in all was a good flight, no dramas to speak of apart from our initial unexpected layover.

I complained to their customer service, and again the service I received was poor. I wrote to the CEO MR Somas Appavoo, and their Chairman MR Sundoo. No response at all from them.
When we returned to the UK 2 weeks later, two Air Mauritius Staff were travelling. They were drunk, pissed, could barely walked. Title: I needed to go from Perth to Nairobi and return from Madagascar.  I had to book Madagascar to Mauritius separately with another airline, but the Air Mauritius fare for the rest of the itinerary was very competitive and the travel times shorter and more humane than the alternatives.The outbound daytime flight in an A330 was good, behind schedule due to headwinds but there's not a lot they can do about that.  I don't remember my seat being particularly uncomfortable so I guess it was OK.  Movie selection was OK but the screen was poor and my unit experienced a lot of interruptions.  I ordered vegetarian food and the first meal was pretty standard Qantas catering, the second was a sandwich which was very dry indeed. Overnight accommodation was provided in Mauritius.  Onward flight to Nairobi was in an A320 and was fine.Returning was not so good.  First of all, the only flight which would allow me to connect from Madagascar arrived at 11am, almost 12 hours before my flight to Perth.  Bonus, you might say, but not when there is nowhere to leave your checked luggage.  The agent in Madagascar had tried to check my bag all the way through, but got a "computer says no" situation.  Air Mauritius wouldn't let me check it in at Mauritius until evening, and there is no left luggage facility in the airport.  In fact if you're transiting, there is basically nothing for you in the airport.  I felt I had little choice but to hire a taxi for the day, which didn't come cheap.Still spent much longer than I wanted to at the airport, there is not much airside either, just a couple of cafes, a Subway and an overpriced spa which I definitely do not recommend.The overnight flight back to Perth was quite full, and I was lucky to be in a row of 4 seats with 2 empty.  But despite this I just could not get comfortable because there were very large equipment boxes under every seat, wherever I put my feet those damned boxes were in the way.  My equipment box wasn't even flush with the seat support, I was left with foot space just 10 inches/25cm wide.I guess it's the luck of the draw which aircraft you will get, but the risk of those boxes under the seat really put me off.  I read that Air Mauritius will soon be rolling out A350s, hopefully the boxes will be gone because their connections from Perth can be very convenient and I would like to try them again.

Title:
We travelled recently to Mauritius and the flight was just terrible. The staff were lovely and the food was ok, but the plane is so cramped that you are uncomfortable from the moment you take your seat. It really is time these planes are ungraded!!

Bearing in mind this is a long haul flight, lasting 12 hours, you'd expect slightly increased space to make it comfortable - well with air Mauritius this isn't the case. You are wedged into an uncomfortable seat with no room to move, in a cabin that is way too hot for comfort and you can't do anything about it for 12 hours.

The entertainment system is also a joke - it's an old style loop system, but the picture is so grainy it's hard to make out what it is showing at times, and the sound worked intermittently every few seconds. So you had no choice but to sit back, uncomfortable and wait for time to pass.

The saddest thing is that this really doesn't represent Mauritius. It is a paradise island and the flight taints that experience. We are loving our time here but already dreading the return flights. It is seriously likely to put us off coming back again, which is sad as this is such a beautiful place.

New planes, better leg room and a newer entertainment system would fix things, and please not only me but the heaps of reviewers saying the same things!

(If anything is different on the return flight I'll of course review again, but I have a feeling we are in for more of the same!)
qwuub: Service good but cramped cabin ruins experience

Title:

Flight there was great, neat, clean, well serviced and attended airplane, everything was on time as scheduled and we actually really enjoyed the experience
This flight was on a Airbus A330, the problem comes with the flight back home

So the flight has been delayed, first by a few minutes, later by an hour and a half
The staff let us know they are offering clients a special upgrade fee of 7000 Rupees to Business class, i immediately agree, however only to be told because i booked with Air Mauritius i can not get the offer, ridiculousness as best i heard, so off to the Air Mauritius counter, only to be told this upgrade special can only be taken up with SAA, and Air Mauritius can upgrade us for 19000 Rupees per person, 7 against 19, wow, what a difference, oh well bad luck for us as Air Mauritius passengers.

This flight back is a joke, Airbus A320, no personal entertainment systems, the shared units in the cabin don't all work, food is disgusting, flight is packed like sardines in a can, understaffed and generally all round disgusting.

On my return i approach Air Mauritius to complain about this, they refer me to SAA as it was an SAA flight, but i booked Air Mauritius, i paid Air Mauritius, all this to no avail

I highly suggest you reconsider booking with Air Mauritius, rather look elsewhere, disgusting customer service with no recourse, although the really great power of "word of mouth" is something we hold dear, please do reconsider this airline.

In actual fact this is not the first time this has happened to family of our and friends, it would actually appear easier if you merely fly SAA directly, as most flights appear to be pushed onto SAA, and then you will be eligible for upgrades at reduced rates etc.,
crvsd: Michael R wrote a review Aug 2017
qwuub: Poor Codeshare return flight with SAA (South Africa Airways)

Title:
Our return business class flight from Mauritius to Johannesburg was on a different aircraft type from the trip to Mauritius. Seating was not true business class but came with three seats where the middle seat left vacant. So although we still enjoyed some extra leg room, seats were narrower than anticipated and there were almost none of the seat adjustment options which were available on our previous flight. There was also a foot rest on the back of my seat which was constantly kicked during the 4 hour flight by the passenger seated behind which was quite uncomfortable. So serious brick bracks to Air Mauritius for that extremely inferior seating arrangement.

Apart from that the service was excellent with the meal completed in 50 minutes (Unlike the 3-4 hours on QANTAS) leaving plenty of time for sleep or relaxation. We were also served with drinks and a bowl of delicious cashews (Unlike the terrible dry and tasteless pretzels served by QANTAS).

Unfortunately we pay for comfortable travel in business class so inferior seating has resulted in my average rating for this flight.
qwuub: Return Business Flight with Air Mauritius

Title:
On emirates and other companies, for boarding, family with children have Priority. Not on Air Mauritius. Staff were late to announce boarding. Then it was a rat race.
On purchasing the tickets I ordered child meal for my two kids. On the flight they were not aware. I asked for it to a male staff. He promised to look into it in 5 minutes. Half an hour later, he still did not showed up. I went to see another female staff, She was very rude, but did come after some time with a printout and told me that there was no child meal ordered. Anyway after five minutes she got me two non veg meals.
I would add here that on the second part of my flight on Jet airways, which I booked at the same time at Air Mauritius office at Cybercity, my kids were served their child meal before adult passengers. And I did not have to ask for it.
Later on the flight I asked a male staff to heat the feeder bottle for my kid. Here again, he asked me to give him 5 minutes that he could wash his hands. Fifteen minutes later I had to go and look for him.
On booking the tickets I asked for seats closed to toilets. I did get them. But when my kid asked to go faire pipi, the toilet was locked. I asked why, I was told bluntly that it was for first class and that I had to go over there. I tried to, but then they were serving food on both lane, and I was told rudely that I had to wait till they finished. Only when I said that my kid will have to do it on the floor that the staff accepted to unlock the toilet.
The tv screen is smaller than the one of my smartphone. And nothing interesting for the kids.
Overall I can say that staff was not very friendly. They looked tired, overwhelmed, and had the attitude of those civil servants that always make you feel that you are disturbing them.
So my advice would be : If you have kids better do not take this airline; If you have to, then have food at the airport itself.

Title:
We were a party of 10 going to Mauritius for a wedding. our Agent Travel bag notified the airline that one of our party had a severe nut allergy. (life threatening) They at first refused to make an announcement on the outward flight but after a lot of pressure made an announcement 40 mins into the flight.
They contacted us in the resort regarding the return flight. They came to us proactively at check in for the return flight. The ground crew promised to make an announcement.
When we got on the plane the cabin crew were not aware. They said its up to the Captain Van Eeden. He refused. So now our party member has been tricked onto a plane with false assurances, is now trapped at 30,000 feet with no where to go. My wife walked the plane and spoke to every single traveller all of whom apart form one fool were very receptive and sympathetic. Some actually helped spread the word. The cabin crew just looked on like idiots. One cabin member Warren Ng was very sympathetic and apologised to my wife that she had to do this.
The rest of the crew showed no empathy or sympathy. The got our group member on the plane with false promises and put her in Jeopardy. None of our family will ever fly with this airline again.
be warned if you have any form of allergy avoid this airline at all costs.

Title:
It’s about a 12 hour direct flight from London to Mauritius you know. That’s a long time to be airborne, bored stiff and twiddling your thumbs and everything else you can twiddle.
Thankfully though that wasn’t the case with my return flight with Air Mauritius though the fact I’d been upgraded to Business Class definitely solved any potential boredom and unrest issues.
We got off to a flying start, relaxing pre-flight in the Air Mauritius lounge providing various drinks and food as well as the ideal 'chill out' area.
As it happened, thanks to the super-comfortable seating, the excellent range of entertainment available and the first-class and ultra-friendly service being afforded at the front end of the aircraft, time quite literally flew by and as a result I arrived in London as fresh as a daisy having gratefully experienced several hours of sound sleep.
Drinks, soft and otherwise, were offered on a regular basis while the on-board meals were excellent too.
No wonder Air Mauritius – the only airline to fly direct non-stop from Heathrow to Mauritius - has been voted the Indian Ocean’s leading airline at the World Travel Awards for ten years on the trot!

Title:
My husband and I have travelled to our favourite destination Mauritius a number of times. This was our first trip back since 2014 to celebrate our 10th wedding anniversary at our favourite resort where we were married.
Over the years we have had no problem with the airline or flight. This year however, the plane being used appeared to be very old and tired, we had the same plane out to Mauritius and back. With the push to encourage Australian tourists to visit, it is sad that the plane is such a disappointment. We were fortunate, we only had to fly from Perth, people traveling from NSW and Victoria, had already flown 4 hours before they got to Perth.
The return journey was the most disappointing, the staff were not very helpful, whilst the plane was nowhere near full, they seemed to busy to be helpful.
Early in the flight one of the attendants was carrying a number of trays on top of each other, she ended up spilling the drinks on the seat in front and the tray, then took off. I watched off and on throughout the 6 hour flight and at no stage did she return to wipe the mess up, the tray was just tucked back in position.

Title:
Hadn't travelled with Air Mauritius for 5 years and didn't have good memories as it was, but it's a direct flight so booked it. It didn't take very long onboard to remember why we didn't have good memories either.
Why do the air staff work there?? They couldn't be more unhelpful, unresponsive or dismissive of passengers if they tried. I don't say this lightly either as I have never written a review of an airline before. I absolutely love Mauritius and intend to visit more frequently in the future but Air Mauritius would truly be a last resort. In Mauritius whether you stay in a 5* hotel or 3* hotel the staff and service is always to be relied on as helpful and very good - which is why I am amazed and disappointed at how bad it is on their national airline. Seriously they should go to even the small 3* hotels in Mauritius and learn what good customer service is. Meals are literally dropped in front of you, drinks are half poured measures and I swear I have never heard air staff say please, thank you or excuse me. This is a 12 hour flight and this is our 5th return journey with them and they're so dismissive of passengers it was upsetting. Other than with meals we were offered 2 drinks for the whole flight and then the staff literally ran down the isle with a tray of warm juice and you had to be quick to take one. if you went to the cabin staff (who kept their curtains constantly closed) they begrudgingly gave you a small measure of drink- that is, if they weren't claiming to be busy or eating, which they did to both me an my husband!!! With meals we had 6 small drinks over the entire flight and felt quite ill from dehydration when we landed which did not help recovery of jetlag. I even joined the Kestrel club as I had intended to travel frequently but I will certainly not do it again. The food and alcohol are really good (if you can get it) The entertainment system didn't work for 2 hours and the staff weren't interested and suggested that we move into one of the many empty seats (no surprise there). We moved 3 times and so did many other unhappy passengers
If the job of serving people is too below you - resign and allow decent hardworking Mauritians the jobs. Seriously Air Mauritius put some secret flyers onboard and see how horrible it is

Title:
This was undoubtedly the worst business class experience myself and my wife have ever had.

The business class seats are exactly the same size as economy class seats. The only difference being that they seat you in the aisle and window seats only and leave the middle seat open.

Generally airline food is pretty poor quality, but Air Mauritius took it to a completely new level. The warm food was pretty much inedible. The starter was supposed to be a duck pate, but resembled something of a boiled duck meat loaf that had been left out in the sun and completely dried out - if they made duck flavoured dog food I would imagine it would look and taste something like what we were served. Judging by the number of almost full trays being sent back by the rest of business class, it was evident that we were not the only passengers dissatisfied by the quality of food.

The air hostesses were also the most grumpiest pair of women in a customer service role that we have ever seem. I think the only time we ever got a smile out of them was when we were departing the plane.

The crew also closed all bar service 1 hour before we landed so you could not even get, so much as a bottle of water, which become a bit of an issue for us as we had an 18 month old toddler with us.

But the absolute cherry on the top was when I went to the toilet during that 1 hour bar service shut down only to find the air hostesses hiding behind the aisle curtain drinking whiskey and champagne. Surely this cannot be in line with airline policy after all what kind of a company allows thier employees to drink alcohol while on duty, let alone employees that are charged with customer safety.

They only reason I gave this review a 1 and not a 0 was because the tickets were relatively cheap - but cheap doesn't always translate into value for money.

It is actually quite a same because all of the problems I have mention above are relatively esdy fixes that could be resolved over night without having to increase costs.

Title:
We experienced this morning an emergency landing in Bangalore airport of Air Mauritus flight BLR-MRU MK 747 destination Mauritius via Chennai. We are safe and sound. But the situation was and is being horribly managed by the airline. Want to share the facts publicly and raise my voice. It's long. But at least I'll prevent other passengers about never flying this airline.

Boarding, take-off, all starts normally. The flight was coming from Mauricio, half full, on the way back to the paradise island departing from Bangalore with stopover in Chennai. All seems OK. Around 30 mins after departure, the air hostess announces that in 20 mins we will be landing in Bangalore. Alberto and me start laughing as we thought she had got confused. 'You meant Chennai not Bangalore' we point her out. But what's our surprise when she replies 'no, we actually got a technical problem and we are returning to Bangalore'. We looked at each other, surprised because there had not been any announcement from the pilot or the crew to the passengers about it. Not at all. Weird? Well yes I think so. Wrong? Totally.
We land back in Bangalore airport. Nicely and softly actually. We look through the window and what's our surprise when suddenly see 2 firefighter trucks waiting for us on the runaway. Ehhh...excuse me: did we just do an emergency landing without being warned about it? Looked like.
The plane stops in the middle of the runway, just like that. We stop moving and nothing happens. No announcements. Motors are turned off. We see airport emergency cars around us, airport staff taking pictures of the plane, and suddenly firefighters who start spraying foam on the left wing landing gear. Still no communication to the passengers apart from 'please remained seated with your seat belt fastened'. We are in the middle of the runway, with foam and smoke everywhere, and all we are told is 'please remained seated with your seat belt fastened'. Not very comforting.
At this point we conclude it's fair to say than yes, this was a freaking emergency landing. It was. We could not believe our eyes. We were not told about it. No passenger had any idea of it. Scary? A lot. Why? Well considering we took off at 5.30am in the morning, most passengers were sleeping, which means we were not ready at all to evacuate the plane in case there had been an emergency. We were not in alert mode, because there had been no announcement or communication from the crew.
I do acknowledge the fact that it's not adequate nor smart to scare the passengers in a situation like this, but it is important to make sure they are aware of the situation they are facing. And we were not. Not at all.
What if things would not have come up as expected in the landing? What if we had needed to evacuate the plane? As I said, we were simply not at all ready for this.
So here we are in the the middle of the runway, where we stay for another 25 mins, 25 long mins. We (or at least I) were scared and uninformed. And the question that was popping up in everyone's minds: why are we not being evacuated?
A towing tractor shows up. The pilot announces that we are going to be carried to the parking area. We reach after 20 mins, and we wait on our seats. We request an explanation. They ask us to wait and be patient. But it's not easy to be patient in a situation where firefighters just sprayed foam right below our butts (apologies).
We wait for another 20 mins, post which we are (finally) evacuated. Brought back to the terminal.
But things are not over. Information from the ground staff? ZERO. 'We dont have information about what happened. Please clear immigration, pick up your luggage and we'll call you'.
Dear Air Mauritius: we just had an emergency landing without prior annoucement, we have been almost an hour in the plane post that, and then thrown in the airport with no staff from your airline to officially communicate us what's going on, which are our rights and when we can expect this or another aircraft to take us to Mauritius. Next? We are sent to a hotel in the city center (not in the airport surroundings), no transportation arranged, no food vouchers given, with no ETD of our flight or information of a potential reallocation in a partner airline aircraft.
From my perspective, Air Mauritius has handled all the situation in a very bad way.

As of the time I am writing this, still NO OFFICIAL COMMUNICATION FROM THE AIRLINE HAS BEEN RECEIVED SINCE WE LEFT THE AIRPORT 10 HOURS AGO.

UNACCEPTABLE.

On top of this, I have tweeted them for the whole day with no replies from their end.

Never ever flying them again and I hope everyone follows this advice.

Btw - heard than a similar situation happened a month back also here in Bangalore and they kept the passengers in the airplane for 5 hours, and then in the airport for 8 hours without ANY information.

This airline is insane!!

Title:
One way to get to Europe--UK, Paris and others is to fly with Air Mauritius via Mauritius. I refuse to fly that far without a one or two night stop over on the way.
Whilst there may be only 2 or 3 flights out of Perth with AM, once you get to Mauritius, there are plenty of departures to London, Paris and others on a daily basis.
I always stay in the local town only 15 minutes from the airport and there are plenty of cheap places to stay in the town--just search online or take a taxi into town and take pot luck!
If you wish to stay longer, there are plenty of places to stay around the Island which may be a couple of hours away by local bus, coach or taxi.
I always contact AM directly at their local office in Perth where they have been most helpful.( Ask for Josie!) It is about 8 hrs Perth to Mauritius and 11 to Paris--depending on the wind!!!
When I last went with AM, the aircraft were not too luxurious but the food and service was very good and prices very competitive. Flying to Paris, you may be lucky enough to fly with Air France on the second leg going out and I have always found that they are brilliant!!
The locals in Mauritius are very friendly and I have always felt completely safe there. The food is excellent--mainly Creole. I have done this trip several times and find it a very relaxing stop over which I much prefer to a large city.

Title:
We booked on Air Mauritius as it was the only direct flight from London we could find on our dates. This has to be the only time I have regretted being on a direct flight and in hind sight think that a stop over in Dubai using Emirates would have been a better option.

The Air Mauritius plane used on the LHR-MRU sector seems quite dated. The seating arrangement is very tight and particularly uncomfortable in economy. The entertainment screens are not of a high quality, and in my case the system had to be reset to get mine to work even. I have travelled on many airlines and the seating room here for some reason felt particularly small compared to others.

There are also no charging points on the seats as is standard these days. I guess this comes down again to the fleet being a bit dated. Unfortunately it's something one feels to be more of a necessity on a 12h flight especially when the on board entertainment screens are not of a high quality. We even asked the cabin crew to help us charge our phones somewhere else but they said it wasn't possible.

The service of the cabin crew for the most part wasn't very polite and felt quite impersonal. The tone and behaviour was rather unfriendly at times. All said and done we somehow managed to settle into our seats preparing for the long haul, and we were looking forward to the food (it was an overnight flight). Unfortunately the food was really bad. What was very strange was they only had two options chicken or fish - there was no choice for vegetarians. We were seated about half way through the second cabin, and even by the time they reached us the chicken was finished forcing us to take the fish. Whereas I understand sometimes you run out of one option quicker. But given where we were seated and how many passengers there were still left to serve after us it just sounds like very bad planning on the airlines' part. When I travel again on this airline I will be carrying my own food.

In conclusion the only reason I call it a 2/5 and not a 1/5 is that it's the only direct flight option I had and it saves us maybe 3hours of journey time. But if I were to do this trip again I wouldn't hesitate one minute to book a stop over flight on Emirates instead.

qwuub: Only good thing is DIRECT flight from LHR

Title:
We set off from Birmingham international airport for the short hop across the channel to Paris Charles de Gaulle . We arrived in Paris on time and thought we would have a wonder around whilst waiting for our connecting flight to Mauritius. We had a four hour connection which I was aware of and had planned it that way.
It was fast approaching 16:20 which was the departure time for our onward flight. Eventually it came upon the screen that the flight had a short delay. Other than that there was no further information other than " the pilot was feeling a little under the weather, so he's gone for a sleep " . Then we were told there was a four hour delay and we should be setting off at approximately 20:20. After making further inquiries we were told it was an 8 hour delay and would not be setting off till gone midnight.
There was a lot of confusion and eventually we were told by another passenger that if we went up to the desk we would be given €16 each so we could get a meal and something to drink. After hunting around for somewhere we could get something we decided that we were not going to get much ( bottle of coke was €5 ) the food was terrible and so overpriced.
We boarded the plane at 00:20 for our 11 hr flight to Mauritius. The plane was cramped, I'm not the biggest person in the world but even I felt the lack of leg room, the seats were so uncomfortable. I put two pillows under me and still got a numb bum. The food was average at best and the beer was warm. It was at this point I wish we'd booked with Emirates ( so much better).
After returning from our holiday I've been in touch with the airline to complain and seek compensation for the delayed flight. So far it's been escalated twice to higher level management , the last time was to the CEO of air Mauritius after being offered 50% off any flight with their airline within the next 12 months . Being as we've already booked for Mexico next year and they don't fly there , this offer was declined and I'm still waiting to hear back from the CEO . Would not fly with Air Mauritius if they offered me free flights for life....waste of time.
qwuub: Will not fly with them again

Title:
Air Mauritius is my mostly used airline, because I live on the island. I have used it several dozen times. The key strength of the airline is that it has direct flights to major cities (Paris, London, Delhi, Johannesburg, Beijing, Kuala Lumpur, and others) so you can expect the quickest flight, compared if you use alternate airlines, where you may end up with 30+ hours flights, including layovers. It also eliminates issues such as missed connection.

The ground & crew service, and the cabin amenities are generally what you expect from other good airlines (such as South African Airways or American Airlines). However is does not have the "luxury touch" (such as Emirates).

The airline has a very good safety record, the pilots are a combination of locals and foreigners, and the cabin crew are always Mauritians (expect Mauritian hospitality!)

High points: 1)One evening, i called their hotline to re-book my long term ticket for the next morning, it was done fast, with a fee of about 30 USD. Shap shap!
2) In all my travels, it has never departed late, neither I had lost luggage.

Low points: 1)Meals are less delicious compared to other airlines. 2) Long haul flights are almost always fully booked, it can feel cramped. 3) Onboard entertainment system is aging technology, time for a change. 4) Some flight attendants are very nice to foreigners but are rude to fellow Mauritians, hope management can curb their attitude.

It all goes down to EITHER get to your destination quick and have fun there OR take your time to reach your destination in a more enjoyable way.
qwuub: Fastest flights to cities it deserves

Title:
I am a regular flyer with British Airways to Mauritius but had to get an urgent, very last minute flight there for 2 of us over a weekend. First impressions do count and when I initially tried BA (on the internet), no flights were available for several days. I saw that Air Mauritius advertised their customer services phone number as 24/7 (not so with BA which was closed) and so I tried it at 11.30pm on a Sat eve. No problem - straight through to a very helpful call centre in MRU itself. The next flight from LHR had just 1 seat available. However, they simply bumped another single passenger up to Business class and thus 2 seats were now available on their flight. Tremendous - I was pleased.
The flight boarded on time and despite a short delay at LHR because it was busy, we arrived on schedule in MRU. The flight was uneventful but I got a seat next to my wife which also pleased me. Cabin crew were pleasant and helpful as I would expect. Food fine. English is the pre-dominant language used by the crew although both French/Creole is fluent to all their staff. Only things that are better with BA are: 1) their entertainment screens are larger and entertainment options more varied - I found it difficult to see using the AM one - too small and 2) the selection of snacks when cruising is not as good. Two final big pluses though for AM - 1) they allowed 30kg of luggage per person as standard, this is 30% more than BA and 2) they have daytime flights - all of the BA flights are overnight and at very inconvenient times. So, will I now convert from BA to Air Mauritius. Let me simply say that I have applied for my AM frequent flyer Kestrel card and hope to use it regularly.

Title: I  expressed some trepidation about flying with an unknown airline across a vast amount of water,  anywhere actually, -  but  the manager of the tour group we were travelling with - Trade Travel - assured me that she had flown with them repeatedly, and had never had cause for concern.  Well, Mauritian Air still does things that the other airlines have abandoned.  I think they handed out damp towels ( how could I not be sure ? ),  followed by little packets of socks, eyemask etc - a lot of people used the masks.  NOT that that is indicative of competent pilots or maintenance of planes !!! ........  Meals were up to airline food standard, plane very clean, some toiletries in some toilets - I guess they get pinched !  We were in cattle class, because that's what we could afford, and it is always an exercise in endurance .  I am short so leg room is rarely an issue, my travel companion is tall.  There was a fixture under the seats which impinged on legroom even for me.  I try to get an aisle seat, because I don't mind getting out for other people, but I don't like having to climb over other passengers.  One thing that  could be improved,  there wasn't a frequent round  of drinks - water and juice - which I use because I believe it is important to keep well hydrated.  I don't like  using the call bell, but I rang for a couple of drinks. I didn't use the inflight entertainment as I read for most of the flight.    The crew was  nicely dressed, polite and seemed to be attentive to people who needed assistance.   Most flights from Australia are long, and you just have to settle down and  try to relax. I get restless legs and need to walk often. There was a handy walkway near the toilet block where I could stand a do some exercises.
qwuub: Often the best thing I can say about long flights is that it beats swimming.

Title:
This was my first time flying with Air Mauritius and I hope it won't be my last ( my return flight next week is via Paris with Air France so watch out for that review ). The flight on the Airbus A3400-300 ( 3B-NAY for all you plane spotters ) left very slightly late but that was not the fault of the airline. At a tad over 6 feet tall I was impressed by the leg room which I felt for economy class was very good. The crew were very attentive and I was quietly surprised by the 2 meals that were served during the 12 hour flight. For supper I opted for the seafood casserole over the thai chicken choice, and the breakfast was a plain omelette with a sausage, potato a small tomato and surprisingly broccoli. The only disappointment for me was the entertainment system which was very dated but I suppose not a surprise for an aircraft that has been in service for over 19 years. The travel kit provided was a nice touch and as the plane was only half full there was plenty of room to bed down for the night but I'm guessing that this isn't the norm.
checkin and customs etc on arrival were all very smooth but baggage collection was a little slow.

Title:
I've flown with Air Mauritius many years ago and because of that experience I've decided to book a Flight/Hotel/Transfer package through the airline.

The legroom on the A319 was worse than the budget airlines on domestic routes in South Africa. I'm 1.78m tall and my knees were pushing against the seat in front of me. My partner, who is 2.05m tall and slim had to sit sideways in his seat with his feet also under the seat in front of me as it was just impossible for him to fit his upper legs in the available legroom.

We were asked, by the cabin crew, not to recline our seats as it will leave no space for the passengers behind us, so we had to sit the entire 4 hour flight in cramped upright positions. The air conditioning was terrible as it was hot and humid inside the plane for the entire flight.

The hotel that they advertised as 4 star (Blumarine Attitude) was terrible and we decided to rather check out and forfeit the money (about 1000 euro) for the remainder of the stay, after the third sleepless night and horrible meals.

We check in, at our own cost (another 1000 euro), into a different 4 star hotel (La Pirogue which should be 40 stars compared to the hotel we left)

I've sent Air Mauritius an e-mail, 4 days ago, about our complaints, I'm now back in South Africa and haven't even received an automated reply. With the service we've received so far from Air Mauritius, I doubt that we will get any response from the airline.

Whatever you do, do not book a hotel through Air Mauritius and ensure that any hotel booking has a free cancellation policy.
